profileAlternative.name: Chris Dickinson
profileAlternative.headline: Staff Engineer at Eaze
profileAlternative.summary:
I turned the npm registry into a teapot.

I work on the infrastructure, services, and data stores backing the npm registry and website. I am a former member of the Node Technical Committee. I've been writing Node programs since 2009, and have apologized for at least 95% of them at some point. I will talk at length about video games, parsers, color use, JS spec minutiae, illustration, comics, etymology, or pictures of cats.

positions.description: Dictate JavaScript style, write JavaScript, evangelize the language.

positions.description: Resident JavaScript advocate; building cool frontend things while still fiddling around with backend logic. Best of both worlds!

positions.title:
Title
Web Developer
positions.description: Helped construct and design a social networking site built around the premise of following villages receiving aid from water.org. Heavy social integration work, intense focus on TDD.

positions.title: Developer
positions.description: Worked on infrastructure and support, built a new product-purchasing workflow, developed an ORM, sped up the admin by eliminating redundant mysql queries, etc.

given.text:
Chris is one the most proficient young programmers I know. His breadth of knowledge and willingness to jump into anything, from coding low-level C extensions to dealing with CSS make him an invaluable resource to any company or client he works with. I highly recommend Chris and hope to have the opportunity to work with him again in the future.
…
See more

received.text: Across both of her roles at npm, Brenna displayed a phenomenal attention to detail and capacity for rising to challenges. Brenna introduced processes around incident retrospectives and deployment that greatly improved the team's efficiency and happiness. Brenna's enthusiasm, technical prowess, and care for both her work and her coworkers are traits that I try to emulate. It was a blast to work with her.

Emily is amazing. In the time that I've worked with her, she's been a jack of all trades — organizing company all hands & travel, maintaining job postings, coordinating the hiring process, making sure the office was running smoothly in general, all in addition to her work as an assistant to the C team. As a remote worker, I really appreciated the lengths Emily would go to to make me feel like I was part of the company & cared for.

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Director of Compliance at Native Roots
